title: Out of bound index cast causes ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
It seems like any in-place cast to `usize` that is out of bounds is causing an ICE. rustc fails on both current stable and nightly. not sure if #52432 is related or not.

minimal reproduction:
```rust
fn main() {
    [0; 3][3u64 as usize];
}
```

playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2015&gist=53b64af01f09b42643ff9283679016ca

full backtrace:

```
error: internal compiler error: librustc_mir/interpret/operand.rs:129: to_immediate: expected Operand::Immediate, got Indirect(MemPlace { ptr: Ptr(Pointer { alloc_id: AllocId(1), offset: Size { raw: 0 } }), align: Align { abi_pow2: 3, pref_pow2: 3 }, extra: None })

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:587:9

note: rustc 1.30.0 (da5f414c2 2018-10-24) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
